comments.author: Pervez Sadiq
comments.content:
The write up is fantastic and it captures the spirit of the trip. I believe that another trip was made on 11th March. When will we recieve that write up.

I would have loved to join you, but the Scuba diving season is ending in March so perhaps next time. Khalid Omar-thanks a lot for sending me the link—and regards to Humayun Qureshi—hope he comes back to Scuba sometimes.

I would be obliged if the GPS points of the trip are posted also

comments.author: Humayun Qureshi
comments.content:
Pervez, thanks. Next year I promise diving. Maybe we can bring many of the off-roaders with us? Maybe just skin diving to give them the taste!

Now you need to get your adventure spirit in the mountains and the valleys, although the season is similar for both diving and offroading.

comments.author: Sajid Dadabhoy
comments.content:
Salman. You have articiulated our memories wonderfully.

Indeed my expedition started a week before when I decided to test the dual shocks on my Defender. Getting the Landy ready for the Dhereji took a minor miricle and it would not have been possible without Taimor Bhai’s and Col. Azmat’s help. So once again thanks a lot guys for your help.

Cant wait for the next expedition and this time I will make sure that I dont start a week before in phase 8.

Sajid

Oh and I must thank my cousin and friend sajjad vaid for braving the phase 8 drive with me…

comments.author: Dr. Awab Alvi
comments.content:
WOW - the entire article was simply captivating.

Khalid has been teasing me with these reviews for some time and this article made me into a believer. Please place my name on your to-call list for the next adventure, and I will cross-my-heart-and-hope-to-die promise that I will definitely join the next off-roaders trip with my Vigo. The pimp-kick-ass truck definitely needs a run for its money its been lounging on the streets of Karachi for too long and needs to flex its muscle.

I’m geared up and ready for the next outing, count me in – Don’t forget me…………

comments.author: khalid Mahmood
comments.content:
I am green with envy with what your adventure and expedition. Thanks, Salim Khan for a prolific write up.

I have climbed the highest peaks in the continental United States and have been an avid back packer in Mexco and California. I believe that Baluchistan offers one of the most beautiful landscapes in the world, both coastal and in land. I only hope that i can join you all in your next expedition. I will apply for membership in your club and hope to qualify for the membership. best regards, Khalid Mahmood

comments.author: Salim Khan
comments.content:
Khaild Mehmood, if i remember correctly, your the guy who went to “Outdoor Adventure” with Behram Avari and the ICI guy, and I was the one who took you there? I recall you having told me about climbing the highest peak in the US.

Hope to see you on the next expedition.

comments.author: Imran Fatmi
comments.content:
Salim, a great narration of the events. 4×4 club has stirred up a new spirit in us to go out and explore our beautiful country. Some of us went to Hingol River and Kund Malir beach on the way recently.http://picasaweb.google.com/addysayeed/HingolDayTrip?authkey=aqt85UT4rDQ. The trip to Dureji was a wonderful experience for me and my daughter. Do let us know of all the upcoming adventures.

Imran Fatmi

comments.author: Alamdar
comments.content:
Can I have GPS Cordinates of your Dureji Trip

Alamdar Hussain

comments.author: Saadia Rahman
comments.content:
I just have one word WOW.

I didnt know something so organized existed in Pakistan as far as adventures are concerned.

The xpeditions are really great! They makeyou get up grab your backpack and hit the highway!

Great work!

comments.author: Mussadiq Janjua
comments.content: I rally surprised to see about this healthy activity, I gone very fresh and excited. thanks for entertaining, such a nice article
